characters.name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
characters.description1: My guide. This industrious young man is both a monk in training and a Khura'inese tour guide.

characters.name: Maya Fey
characters.description1: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.

characters.name: Ema Skye
characters.description1: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensic investigator.

characters.name: Tahrust Inmee
characters.description1: Khura'inist high priest in charge of the rites of Lady Kee'ra. Killed during the Purification Rite. Has a clergyman's mark on his brow.

characters.name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
characters.description1: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."

characters.name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
characters.description1: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last moments of the dead.

characters.name: Puhray Zeh'lot
characters.description1: An apprentice priest living in the high priest's house. He's like part of the family.
characters.description2: Proven to be a fake name. His real name was Rheel Neh'mu. His real identity was that of a Khura'inist monk.

characters.name: ??? → Datz Are'bal
characters.description1: A strange guy. You can't see his face on account of his beard. Pretty suspicious, if you ask me.
characters.description2: XO of the Defiant Dragons. He escaped from prison. At one point he was a paratrooper in some country's airborne unit.

characters.name: Beh'leeb Inmee
characters.description1: Widow of the victim. She usually plays the part of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.

evidences.name: Attorney's Badge
evidences.description1: My all-important badge. Proof of my profession.

evidences.name: Rites Guide
evidences.description1: A guide to Khura'inese rites written for tourists.

evidences.name: May 9th Newspaper
evidences.description1: A newspaper from the morning of the Purification Rite. It reports on the weather and Lady Kee'ra's activities, among other things.

evidences.name: Tahrust's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Cause of death was blood loss from an abdominal wound delivered by a bladed weapon.

evidences.name: Ritual Curtain
evidences.description1: A curtain around the perimeter of the sanctum, isolating it from the outside world. The entrance was shut during the rite.

evidences.name: Bloodstained Letter
evidences.description1: A letter we found at the Inner Sanctum. A giant bloodstain makes it impossible to read in full.

evidences.name: Sanctum Prayer Flags
evidences.description1: Prayer flags found outside of the ritual curtain. They have been sewn together into a long banner.

evidences.name: Inner Sanctum Photo
evidences.description1: Shows the high priest's body, a shoveled-out area of snow, and a lantern with a broken wind guard.

evidences.name: Maya's Statement
evidences.description1: On the day of the rite, the water in the spring was already stained red when Abbot Inmee and Maya arrived at the Inner Sanctum.

evidences.name: Lady Kee'ra's Warning
evidences.description1: A warning from Lady Kee'ra to Abbot Inmee. Only someone capable of entering the priest's home could have delivered it.

evidences.name: Warbaa'd Arrow
evidences.description1: Resembles the three-pronged arrows once used by Lady Kee'ra. Discovered near the high priest's home.

evidences.name: Mountain Range Poster
evidences.description1: A poster and a photograph of the entire Inner Sanctum and Mt. Poniponi area.

evidences.name: Envelope
evidences.description1: An envelope addressed to the high priest. There is no return address, and three unusual-looking holes are punched into it.

evidences.name: Wanted Poster
evidences.description1: A wanted poster describing the escaped prisoner. Mentions a sizeable reward.

evidences.name: Plumed Punisher Strap
evidences.description1: This one-of-a-kind strap plays "The Plumed Punisher" theme when the magatama on her belt is pressed.

evidences.name: Inner Sanctum Diagram
evidences.description1: Shows where Maya and the high priest were during the rite.

evidences.name: Crime Photo (Zeh'lot)
evidences.description1: Killed in the Plaza of Devotion. He has a peach-shaped tattoo on the nape of his neck.

evidences.name: Zeh'lot's Autopsy Report
evidences.description1: Cause of death was a spinal cord injury from being stabbed in the upper back by a bladed weapon.

evidences.name: Warbaa'd Dagger
evidences.description1: A dagger modeled after a warbaa'd. Said to have been used by Lady Kee'ra.

evidences.name: Brand New Flag
evidences.description1: A brand-new prayer flag found at the Plaza of Devotion. Has some writing on it.

evidences.name: Nahmanda Flower
evidences.description1: A flower the Khura'inese use to pay tribute to the departed. Expresses heartfelt sympathy.

evidences.name: Beh'leeb's Statement
evidences.description1: A statement about the Feast of Blessings that was held the day before the rite.

evidences.name: Family Photo
evidences.description1: A picture of Maya and the high priest's family taken during the Feast of Blessings on the day before the rite.

evidences.name: Tome of Secrets
evidences.description1: A tome given only to the one who will play the role of Lady Kee'ra in the Purification Rite.

evidences.name: Dhurke's Law Book
evidences.description1: Branding it with the Defiant Dragons mark demonstrates the strength of Dhurke's convictions.

evidences.name: Golden Orb
evidences.description1: An orb entrusted to me by Mr. Are'bal. It seems to be the key to the rebel hideout.

evidences.name: Rebel Hideout Photo
evidences.description1: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. There was a luminol reaction near the entrance.
evidences.description2: A photo of the secret rebel hideout. It is just as Abbot Inmee saw it after the incident.

evidences.name: Warbaa'd Statue
evidences.description1: Its sharp, protruding feathers took Puhray Zeh'lot's life. It's also a revolving door.
